text:
On June 4, 1989, in Tiananmen Square, student-led pro-democracy demonstrations occurred. 
The Chinese government sent the People's Liberation Army to suppress the movement. 
Thousands died and even more were injured or imprisoned. 
The Tank Man stood bravely before Type 59 tanks. 
Martial law was declared by Premier Li Peng. 
General Secretary Zhao Ziyang sympathized with the students. 
The death of Hu Yaobang was a catalyst. 
Students staged hunger strikes and erected the Goddess of Democracy.

In 1989, there were protests in a major square in Beijing. 
Thousands were affected, with many wounded or imprisoned. 
Military presence was heavy, and it was linked to political reforms and student unrest. 
A statue symbolizing freedom was erected during the time.
In 1987, students protested about cafeteria food. No government response occurred.
One man stood in front of tanks in a powerful protest image.
Tank Man stood before tanks. Thousands died during the military crackdown.
